title: So, can we address some of Morde's unhealthy aspects before even considering tinkering with him?
body:
A lot of suggestions regarding Morde were just adding stuff to him without really compensating for the added power.
Mordekaiser has been a very difficult champion to balance because of his Passive and to some extent his ultimate.

His laning phase in particular can be extremely oppressive like pre-rework darius and Garen to some extent while his own rework didn't really tackled these kinds of game health issues.

So, before we just add to his numbers and such we have to consider revising his passive interaction to really try making Mordekaiser more satisfying and fairer for both the Morde player and his vict...erm....opponents.

He could definitely profit from some low-scope changes to fix his lack of interaction during the laning phase but also giving Morde other ways to succeed other than just dominating lane and then snowballing a lead or just completely fall short after it.

My personal suggestion would be weakening the shield gained from minions if not outright removing them in favor of maybe increased shield generation of enemy champions and actually juggernaut base stats.

Another wonky Idea was giving his E a small implosion effect and changing it to vector casting.
Outwards: Small knock back
Inwards; Small pull (maybe 100 units or so)

Still, the fact remains, if Morde needs buffs Riot should just invest some extra time in changing more than just basic numbers in his kit.
Just look at the Urgot changes, they actually shifted numbers AND added stuff instead of just giving him simple buffs

So, probably an unpopular opinion: I think his shield passive is holding him back. 

It's what makes his base stats low because he effectively has two healthbars in fights and while the shield bar is based on a portion of his health, it relies on his damage output to keep up. So with enough damage the shield won't ever fall. 

I don't know what to replace it with and I can't say that this opinion is well informed, but I feel it is what's holding him back.

Not an unpopular opinion.

It's a very valid point.
His shield is unintuitive, it's calculated from damage dealt and generates even on minions.

Unlike Vi's and Shen's his passive isn't reliable or a static amount but its efficiency is based on enemy MR, his own damage and more.

Now, I feel shielding is very important to Morde as a character but it should be more reliable and reactionary than just something linked to how many spells you can spam.

That's why in the short term I feel his passive should be shifted into Vi/Shen territory and only work on champions, making him do juggernaut things in combat but not outright win lane because he just spammed every skill.
I could see it being moved to an ability passive honestly. Like sharing space with his W.

How would you feel about the following?

* Shield generation scales off # of units damaged by an ability and by type of unit (champ, monster, minion).
* Shield amount generated per unit hit increases with AP
* Shield rapidly decays (Say, at max, decays over 3 seconds)
* Max shield cap is increased by his Max HP instead of level.

All in all, if Rylais even gets removed, Mordekaiser's passive should be changed into a something related to movement speed. If you use an ability, you will gain X movement speed (scaling until level 18) for X seconds.
And so after this, a few of his awful base stats can be compensated, except for his movement speed.

{{champion:82}} **Mordekaiser**
- Base Health changed to 500 (+95 per level) from 525 (+73 per level)
(Total Health: 500-2115 (625-2644 including passive))
**Passive- Iron Man**
- No longer interacts with minions
- Shield now stops decaying at 15/30/45/60% (at levels 1/6/11/16) from 25%
- Damage converted increased to 30% from 25%
- Now converts shield **before** reductions
**R- Children of the Grave**
- Now heals from damage **before** reductions
- Now heals for 60% of the damage dealt (tentative)

_Goal:_ Increase interaction in lane while also slightly reducing potential lane power. However, this power returns and becomes incredible late game. Also, Mordekaiser's Passive and Ultimate shield/healing now provide shielding and healing based on damage dealt before reductions so Mordekaiser's own durability isn't gimped by his opponents also being more durable.

How is this?

The stats are great, keeping his resistances low actually make damage stick and his decent Armor/level growth makes him end up on the same level as other juggernauts.

His shield ratio should probably stay 25% max hp as it's simply a CAP and nothing more.
The conversion being 40% BEFORE resists would make his Q extremely strong so I'd suggest just beefing up the ratio to 30% and then make it be calculated before resists.

Decay should still be a thing but it should stop decaying at 15, 30, 45, 60 % at levels 1/6/11/16 since you really just want some shield at the beginning of team fights while giving him a decaying shields during the lane and make poke stick.

The rest's pretty reasonable, it should just streamline his defenses and make him less feast or famine while addressing the frustration of his shield during the laning phase.

In defense of the current version, the shield conversion on minions is already severely reduced, and the E is giving a % of max shield independently of damage dealt, so they already tried to tackle the snowball side of things. The W also has a **significant** CD and is a huge part of Morde's sustain, so if he wastes it on minions, the opponent has a clear window of vulnerability to engage him.

It's not perfect yet, of course, and we can push this further and out-right remove shield conversion on minions. But let's give credit where credit is due, the problems you mention are on Riot's radar and have been addressed.

IMHO, the Ult is a bigger problem than the current version of the shield. You can do shit all game long and just solo-win a game that should have been lost with one good ult on a fed enemy in late game, and I feel like this eat a huge portion of Morde power budget.
